long_instructions.Function intro Ryan:
**មុខងារ**ឈ្មោះ`build bridge`
ដែលនៅក្នុងកន្លែលសរសេរកូដ។ កូដទាំងអស់របស់អ្នកដែលត្រូវប្រើសំរាប់ឆ្លងទន្លេត្រូវបានរៀបចំ!\
\
ចុចលើប្លុកតូចពណ៌បៃតងពីរដងនៅក្នុងកន្លែងសរសេរកូដរបស់អ្នកដើម្បីកែតម្រូវនូវផ្លូវនិងអោយ {currentPlayerName} ទៅកាន់គប់ភ្លើងថ្មក្រហម [redstone_torch]។

long_instructions.OPD-K5-forloops-2:
Write the code to help the bee
collect all of the nectar.\
\
You will need lots of blocks for this challenge,
but we'll learn an easier way in the next puzzle.
long_instructions.OPD-K5-forloops-6:
You can also use a `for` loop
to count down. \
\
Try gathering this nectar by counting down from **5**
to **1** by **1**.
long_instructions.OPD-K5-forloops-7:
The last number in your `for`
loop is called the **"increment"**.  Each time the loop is run, the counter
variable changes by the value of the **increment**.\
\
Try collecting
these flowers using an **increment** of 2.
long_instructions.OPD-K5-variables-1:
Let's draw
an equilateral triangle. \
\
It has to be exactly 50 pixels long on each
side.\
\
long_instructions.OPD-K5-variables-2:
Now use another loop to draw
three of those triangles right next to each other.   \
\
You can nest
the code from your last puzzle inside.

long_instructions.courseF_bee_conditionals10:

even when you know exactly what is in each spot!\
\
Collect all of the
nectar and make all of the honey.

blocking my view!"_\
\

If there's a flower, get nectar.

see any flowers!"_\
\
Check underneath every cloud to see if it is hiding
a flower before you get nectar. If there is a flower underneath the cloud,
the bee will need to get nectar **once**.  \

hide the same thing!

nectar once if there is a flower. Otherwise, make honey once (because there
is a honeycomb).

long_instructions.courseF_bee_functions2:
To make things easier, it's
time to learn about functions!\
\
From here on out, you will be using
a new _function editor_.  This editor is a separate window that will appear
when you go to edit a function.  You won't see all of the code from your
function while you're coding in the workspace, but don't worry...it's still
there!  \
\_\_\_\
\
Let's practice with this function that gets nectar
only if the bee is at a flower.  To see the code inside, click the blue "edit"
button!\
\
Use the `get only nectar` function to collect the nectar from
each flower.
long_instructions.courseF_bee_functions3a:
Each cloud could be hiding
either one flower or one honeycomb!  Write a function that gets nectar if
the bee is at a flower, otherwise it gets honey.\
\
Use your function
to solve the puzzle!
long_instructions.courseF_bee_functions4:
Did you know that you can
call a function from _inside_ another function?  \
\
Use your `check nectar
or honey` function inside the new `move and check` function to help the bee
turn, go get what's under the cloud, then back-up and turn back around!
long_instructions.courseF_bee_functions6:
_"This field is a-MAZE-ing!"_\
\
Build
your own function to help the bee through the maze by turning left at flowers
and right at honeycomb.  Don't forget to collect nectar and make honey along
the way!
long_instructions.courseF_bee_functions7:
Rebuild your function from
the last puzzle to solve this maze.\
\
Turn left at the honeycomb and
right at the flowers.  \
**Note:** Some corners are unmarked!
long_instructions.courseF_bee_functions8a:
Underneath
this cloud, there might be a flower with an unknown amount of nectar, or a
honeycomb with an unknown amount of honey.  \
\
Can you write a program
that can handle either?
long_instructions.courseF_bee_functionsPre7:
Now try building a function
to solve this maze.  How is it different from last time?  \
\
Turn left
at the honeycomb and right at the flowers.  \
**Note:** Some corners are
unmarked!
long_instructions.courseF_bee_fwp1:
Check beneath the clouds to see
if the flowers have any nectar.  \
\
For this whole stage, each flower
will have exactly **one** unit of nectar, and each honeycomb will need exactly
**one** unit of honey. \
\
\
long_instructions.courseF_bee_fwp2:
Here's some code that solves
the last puzzle.  \
Let's pull it into a function, then call the function
to check this row for nectar.  \
\_\_\_\
This may seem like a strange step
now, but it will be really helpful soon!
long_instructions.courseF_bee_fwp3:
Time to put the function to the test!
\
\
Let's see if it makes collecting these three rows of nectar any easier.
long_instructions.courseF_bee_fwp4:
_"How is your function holding up?"_   \
\
We
need to make some adjustments here. Click "edit" to add a `length` parameter
to the function so that it will still work when the row is a different length.
long_instructions.courseF_bee_fwp5:
_"You're doing great so far!"_\
\
Let's
use this function to collect the nectar.
long_instructions.courseF_bee_fwp6:
You can make code shorter and
more efficient when you combine functions with other programming elements.  \
\_\_\_\
What
blocks can you use with your function to build a short and sweet solution
to this puzzle?
long_instructions.courseF_bee_fwp_challenge2:
_"**Lettuce** see if
you can handle this one final test! Give it everything you've got!"_\
\
Use
one `for loop` in a function to collect all of the vegetables in the row.
Make the `for loop` count to different maximum values by using the `length`
parameter. Make your program as short as possible by using a second `for loop`
outside the function.\
\
Good luck!
long_instructions.courseF_playlab_variables1a:
Variables can be used
to store text that you want to use later.  \
\
Have Kiki, the soccer player,  scream
"Goal!" by assigning that text to the `shout` variable.
long_instructions.courseF_playlab_variables2b:
We can make sentences
more interesting by mixing pieces of text with variables.\
\
Insert the
variable `color` into the middle of a sentence by putting it into the empty
slot in the `join` block.
long_instructions.courseF_playlab_variables4b:
Now, Pirate Pegleg
has some questions for Brian.\
\
This code uses an `ask` block, so you
can type Brian's answers after you click "Run". \
\
Put the variables
in the correct places to create this conversation.
long_instructions.courseF_playlab_variables5c:
Let's combine the
`ask` block with an `if/else` statement to have some fun!\
\
Pirate Pegleg
is going to ask you a question.  Drag a copy of the `answer` variable into
the conditional for the `if` statement to check whether or not you entered
the correct color.
long_instructions.courseF_playlab_variables6c:
In the rest of this
stage, we will use multiple `ask` blocks and multiple `if/else` statements
to create a game that **you** control!\
\
Start by setting the "codename"
variable to a word that you can remember.  Then, use an `ask` block to get
a codename from the users.  You will need an `if/else` block to see if the
codename entered matches the codename that you have set.
long_instructions.courseF_playlab_variables7b:
Time to make your own
project!  \
\
Create some questions and weave the answers together into
your very own story.\
\
If you need ideas, click the hints icon.
long_instructions.courseF_playlab_variables7c:
Add another `ask` block
to ask the user to guess a color.  \
\
Keep your `if/else` statement such
that your codename always wins the game, but every other codename always loses.
long_instructions.courseF_playlab_variables_challenge2:
Now for a
game of tag! Tag Cat to get 2 points. Tag Penguin to get 3 points.  Get exactly
10 points to win!\
But be careful, when Cat and Penguin tag each other,
they take points away.\
\
Add the blocks necessary to make this game work
the way it's been explained.\

-   How will you get Dog to move in all directions
    using the arrow keys?\
-   How will you add points when Dog tags Cat or Penguin?\
-   \-
    How will you subtract points when Cat and Penguin touch?

long_instructions.iceage_throw_hearts:

long_instructions.iceage_warn_ice_age:

an ice storm is coming! \

Sid’s (actor 1) speed to fast.\
Press "Run" and move Sid to Diego to warn
him.

long_instructions.CSD U6 setProperty Text:
# ការ​ផ្លាស់ប្តូរ​អត្ថបទ

`setProperty` ប្លុកអាច​ត្រូវ​បាន​ប្រើ​ដើម្បី​ផ្លាស់​ប្តូរ​អ្វីៗ​ជាច្រើន​របស់​ធាតុ​រចនា​ ​រួម​ជាមួយនឹង​អត្ថបទ​ដែល​មាននៅ​ក្នុង​ធាតុ​រចនា​នោះ​ដែរ។

# សូម​ធ្វើ​ដូចនេះ

-   ទាញចេញនូវ `setProperty` ប្លុក
-   សម្រាប់​ប៉ារ៉ាម៉ែត្រ​ដំបូង​ ​សូម​ជ្រើសរើស "name" (id របស់ធាតុ)
-   សម្រាប់​ប៉ារ៉ាម៉ែត្រ​ទីពីរ​ ​សូម​ជ្រើសរើស​ ​"text"​ ​(​គុណ​លក្ខណៈ​ដែល​អ្នក​ចង់​កំណត់​)
-   សម្រាប់​ប៉ា​រ៉ា​ម៉ែត្រ​ទីបី​ ​សូម​សរសេរ​ឈ្មោះ​របស់​អ្នក​នៅចន្លោះ​សញ្ញា​បន្តក់​ពីរ​ ​(​តម្លៃ​ដែល​ត្រូវ​កំណត់​)

_សម្គាល់​៖ ​យើង​បាន​លុប​ផ្ទាំង​រចនា​ម៉ូដ​ឥឡូវ​នេះ​ ​ដើម្បី​ឱ្យ​អ្នកធ្វើការ​អនុវត្ត​ជាមួយ​ ​`setProperty`​ ​ប៉ុន្តែ​វា​នឹង​ត្រឡប់មកវិញ​នៅ​ពេលក្រោយ​នៅពេលដែល​អ្នកបង្កើត​កម្មវិធី​ដោយខ្លួនឯង​។_

long_instructions.CSD U6 setProperty xy:
# ការ​ផ្លាស់​ប្តូរ​ទីតាំង គ្រប់​ធាតុ​ទាំង​អស់​ (លើកលែងតែអេក្រង់) មាន​កូអដោនេ "x" និង​ "y" សម្រាប់​កំណត់​ទីតាំង​របស់​វា ។ # ចូរ​ធ្វើតាម​​សេចក្តីណែនាំ
![expandable](https://images.code.org/3a67642609071cf6766c296b8ca5a68e-image-1526944857178.png)
ប្រើប្រាស់ `setProperty` ប្លុក​ ដើម្បីផ្លាស់​ទី "red\_button" អោយ​ត្រូវនឹងរូបភាពនៅខាងស្តាំ ​។ (ចុចលើរូបភាពដើម្បីមើលទំហំពេញ) _​កំណត​ ​ចំណាំ: ពួកយើង​បាន​លុប​ចោល​នូវ​ ផ្ទាំងរចនា ឥឡូវ​នេះ​អ្នក​អាច​អនុវត្ត​ធ្វើការ​ជាមួយ​ setProperty, ប៉ុន្តែ​វា​នឹង​ត្រលប់​មក​សភាព​ដើម​វិញ​ ក្រោយ​ពេល​អ្នក​​បង្កើត​កម្មវិធី​ដោយ​ខ្លួន​ឯង​​ ។_​

# ការ​ផ្លាស់​ប្តូរ​ទីតាំង គ្រប់​ធាតុ​ទាំង​អស់​ (លើកលែងតែអេក្រង់) មាន​កូអដោនេ "x" និង​ "y" សម្រាប់​កំណត់​ទីតាំង​របស់​វា ។ # ចូរ​ធ្វើតាម​​សេចក្តីណែនាំ

ប្រើប្រាស់ `setProperty` ប្លុក​ ដើម្បីផ្លាស់​ទី "red\_button" អោយ​ត្រូវនឹងរូបភាពនៅខាងស្តាំ ​។ (ចុចលើរូបភាពដើម្បីមើលទំហំពេញ) _​កំណត​ ​ចំណាំ: ពួកយើង​បាន​លុប​ចោល​នូវ​ ផ្ទាំងរចនា ឥឡូវ​នេះ​អ្នក​អាច​អនុវត្ត​ធ្វើការ​ជាមួយ​ setProperty, ប៉ុន្តែ​វា​នឹង​ត្រលប់​មក​សភាព​ដើម​វិញ​ ក្រោយ​ពេល​អ្នក​​បង្កើត​កម្មវិធី​ដោយ​ខ្លួន​ឯង​​ ។_​

long_instructions.iceage_move_to_actor: ឌីអេកូរ (អ្នកសំដែងទី ១) គឺកំពុងស្វែងរម៉ានី (អ្នកសំដែងទី ២)។ តេីអ្នកអាចជួយនាំពួកគេទាំងពីរនាក់មកកាន់គ្នាបានទេ? ភ្ចាប់ប្លក់ព្រិត្តិការណ៍ `ពេលអ្នកសំដែងប៉ះ` ដេីម្បីលេងសំលេងពេល ពួកគេរកឃេីញគ្នា។
